The National Museum of Fine Arts (NMFA) in Athens has been awarded a $10 million grant from the European Regional Fund for Germany (DFG) in support of its expansion plans. The funding will allow the museum to create new research, education, and conservation spaces in the building directly across from the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) in New York. The extension will also allow the museum to add five more galleries and five more exhibitions in the building’s interior. Established in 1928, the fund has given €8.7 billion to German cultural entities and institutions in support of cultural projects since 2008.
